level.heading: Child support orders for 2 or more obligees.
level.text: In responding to registrations or petitions for enforcement of 2 or more child support orders in effect at the same time with regard to the same obligor and different individual obligees, at least one of which was issued by a tribunal of another state, a tribunal of the District shall enforce those orders in the same manner as if the orders had been issued by a tribunal of the District.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-137, in the section heading, deleted "Multiple" preceding "child"; and deleted "multiple" preceding "registrations" and "orders".

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-81
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-81, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 46-301.01.

level.heading: Effective Dates
level.text: Applicability: Section 3 of D.C. Law 16-137 provided: "This act shall apply as of April 1, 2007."

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 208 of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act (2001 Act).
